sentence.Network_en: We talk glibly of equality of opportunity.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们信口开河地谈论机会均等问题。

sentence.Network_en: He glibly professed his ignorance of the affair.
sentence.Network_cn: 他口口声声表白不知道这件事.

sentence.Network_en: He put ashes on his head , apologized profusely , but then went glibly about his business.
sentence.Network_cn: 他表示忏悔, 满口道歉, 但接着又故态复萌了.

list.abs: Zheng Shouwen says to go is to go , but cannot shoot the face in me , should shoot it is under the neck , the glibly that bring a young animal agrees .郑瘦文说行是行，但不能射在我的脸上，要射在脖子以下，安仔满口答应。
Why was he lying so glibly ?, 他怎么会说谎说得这么流利呢?

entry.def: If you describe what someone says as glib, you disapprove of it because it implies that something is simple or easy, or that there are no problems involved, when this is not the case.

example.tran: 对“昔日苦难”的轻描淡写

example.ex: Mr. Lewis takes an insufferably glib attitude toward it all.
example.tran: 刘易斯先生对这一切不以为意，令人厌恶。

auth_sentence.content: The UN talks glibly about restoring the Somali state.

auth_sentence.content: The word "Trust" is used too glibly in the NHS.
auth_sentence.res_content: The word "Trust" is used too glibly in the NHS.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The word "Trust" is used too glibly in the NHS.

auth_sentence.content: We often talk glibly about "the triumph of the human spirit".
auth_sentence.res_content: We often talk glibly about "the triumph of the human spirit".
